brief.content-text:
The diagram compares a physical terminal connection to a server and a remote Telnet connection.

Initially, the physical terminal has a direct connection to the server. The dir command is issued, which displays several subdirectories on the server.

When the Telnet button is selected, the physical terminal changes to a virtual terminal and becomes a Telnet client connected through a network cloud to the Telnet server. The dir command is issued again and displays several subdirectories on the server.

The caption text states: Telnet provides a way to use a computer, connected via the network, to access a network device as if the keyboard and monitor were directly connected to the device.
